* @param content Contains message, start and end dates.

* Returns string representation of task to be stored in file.

* Represents a task with modifiable status.
* Returns status icon of the task.
* @return String representation of the generic task
* Returns String representation of task with additional details.
* Returns the type icon dedicated to the todo task.
* Returns string representation of todo task to be stored in file.
* @return String representation of todo task to be stored in file.
deadline [M] /by [D] - Creates a deadline task with end date
event [M] /from [D] /to [D] - Creates an event task with start/end date
mark [R] - Marks task as done, replace [R] with rank of task.
unmark [R] - Marks task as not done, replace [R] with rank of task.
find [K] - Lists all matching task, replace [K] with keyword.
* DDD - next day of week, exclusive of today
* Otherwise, the time will be treated as plain text.

This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
REM create bin directory if it doesn't exist

REM compile the code into the bin folder
REM run the program, feed commands from input.txt file and redirect the output to the ACTUAL.TXT
REM compare the output to the expected output
